title: 104_hr3117
content: AUTHORITY TO ESTABLISH AND OPERATE MANAGED HEALTH-CARE PLANS. The Secretary may establish managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, to deliver health care services through Department facilities or other entities. The Secretary may establish managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, to deliver health care services through Department facilities or other entities. These plans must adhere to standards set by the Secretary in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services, including providing minimum health care benefits to veterans enrolled in the plan, which must include benefits covered under parts A and B of the Medicare program. The Secretary may also establish an enrollment system for these plans. The Secretary may establish an enrollment system for veterans in managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code. Cost-sharing requirements for veterans enrolled in these plans may include an enrollment premium, copayment charges, and deductibles to cover costs not paid by the Medicare program under title XVIII of the Social Security Act. Payments received for care provided to veterans enrolled in a health-care plan under this section will be credited to the Department's medical appropriation. The Secretary cannot operate a plan at a Department facility unless sufficient funds have been allotted for needed hospital care. The director is authorized to provide hospital care and medical services to veterans likely to require such care during the fiscal year. A new item is added to the table of sections in the chapter. Establishment of managed health-care plans. Requirement for payment for certain services provided by department facilities. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, allows the Secretary of Health and Human Services to make Medicare payments for certain veterans enrolled in Department managed health care plans. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code allows Medicare payments for veterans in managed health care plans certified under section 1705, deemed as Medicare Choice organizations under section 1857 of the Social Security Act. The Secretary certifies a list of these plans annually to the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code allows Medicare payments for veterans in managed health care plans certified under section 1705. The Secretary certifies a list of these plans annually to the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The terms 'Medicare program', 'Medicare-eligible veteran', and 'Medicare Choice organization' are defined in this section. The Social Security Act is amended by adding a new section 1729A to Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code for Medicare payments to veterans in managed health care plans certified under section 1705. Medicare payment for certain veterans under Section 1729A of title 38, United States Code, applies to care provided after the enactment of this Act.
